column5: The EPC Contractor continues to deliver key contract milestones later than those defined in the contract.  Free flow injections into the reservoir started in June and are continuing.  The NW Natural project team is focusing attention and efforts on gettin

column12:
• ?? On December 21st, SNC terminated their contact with Harder Mechanical who was performing the mechanical and electrical work for the project.  On Jan. 4th, SNC contracted with JH Kelly to complete the compressor station construction. ?
  • The Forecast + Actuals amount increased from $143.8 million to $144.4 million due to costs relating to the Port Westward 2 meter set that was inadvertently excluded from this report in in September, October and November.

column14:
• EPC Contractor:
    • Continuing civil/structural activities at the compressor station
    • Continue with installation of  the two Compressor Units and their auxiliary equipment
    • Completed setting Regen Skids 215 and 225 on their foundations Dec. 10th. There were the last remaining large equipment that needed to be shipped to the project site.
    • Continued the construction activities to install facilities to meet spill containments requirements
    • HMI design modifications started 
  •  NW Natural:
    • Continued working on modifications to Beaver meter run
    • IT related work continues to prepare for commissioning
column15:
• EPC Contractor to:
    • Remobilize new contractor to continue civil/structural/electrical construction activities at Adams Well Pad and the Compressor Station
    • Continue power cable pull and splicing operations
    • Continue installation of control cables
    • Complete construction activities to complete facilities to meet spill containments requirements
    • Begin construction of the radio communication towers. Waiting on building permit.
    • Complete grouting of compressor skids to foundations 
  • NW Natural to:
    • Complete modifications to Beaver meter run
    • Continue installation of NWN electrical and IT items needed for the project
